files.Title: McMaster.Extensions.CommandLineUtils.AllowedValuesAttribute

Specifies a set of allowed values and a comparer used to determine if a value is in that set.

By default, value comparison is case-sensitive. To ensure case matches exactly, set to false.

files.Title: McMaster.Extensions.CommandLineUtils.Conventions.CommandNameFromTypeConvention
files.Summary:
Sets the command name based on the model type, if is not otherwise set.

This attempts to infer a command name using a few rules, such as using kebab-case and trimming "Command" from the name of the type. AddCommand => "add" RemoveItemCommand => "remove-item"

files.Title: McMaster.Extensions.CommandLineUtils.Pager
files.Summary:
Process access to a console pager, which supports scrolling and search.

This is done by piping into `less` command (Linux/macOS only.) Windows is currently not supported.

files.Title: McMaster.Extensions.CommandLineUtils.ResponseFileHandling
files.Summary:
Specifies options for how to handle response files. The parser treats arguments beginning with '@' as a file path to a response file.

A response file contains additional arguments that will be treated as if they were passed in on the command line. Response files can have comments that begin with the # symbol. You cannot use the backslash character (\) to concatenate lines.
